intro: Monochaetum mariae, commonly known as the Marie's monochaetum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. This species is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, which can hold water. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in coastal or sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
